thread.title: Leaders of mosque alerted Homeland Security to Denver shooting suspect; ‘Seems to be very radicalized’
thread.title_full: Leaders of mosque alerted Homeland Security to Denver shooting suspect; ‘Seems to be very radicalized’

author: Brett T.
title: Leaders of mosque alerted Homeland Security to Denver shooting suspect; ‘Seems to be very radicalized’
text:
Police have released a mugshot of Joshua Cummings, 37, who they suspect approached a private security guard working for the Regional Transportation District and shot him in the head. Denver mosque leaders feared RTD shooting suspect had radicalized, reported him to Homeland Security https://t.co/DncHfFST4A pic.twitter.com/hDN6QDiyA1 
— Jesse Aaron Paul (@JesseAPaul) February 3, 2017 
Police say they don’t have a motive, but the Denver Post reports that Cummings’ social media postings “are filled with references to Islam, police brutality and the failing of the United States.” “We have concerns…Was the officer a target because he was wearing a uniform?” https://t.co/uNHN7A1k6H 
— Jesse Aaron Paul (@JesseAPaul) February 1, 2017 
Furthermore, CBS4 in Denver cites a “well-placed law enforcement source” who claims that investigators turned up Cummings’ name on a terror watch list about a month ago, after Cummings filed a police report with a suburban Denver police department. Local officers then contacted the FBI Joint Terrorism Task Force in Colorado twice, a second time after learning that Cummings was still living at an area motel. Multiple Warnings To FBI About RTD Shooting Suspect https://t.co/WAawt9fQKz pic.twitter.com/qdvJbr4hjg
